summary: The Mitigation Action and Watermen Support Act of 2025 (MAWS Act) establishes a pilot program to address the overpopulation of blue catfish in the Chesapeake Bay. The Secretary of Commerce is directed to award funds to entities (pet food, animal feed, or aquaculture feed manufacturers/processors) to purchase blue catfish from watermen and seafood processors. The program aims to support watermen, stimulate the market for blue catfish, and assess the impact of the program on the ecosystem and local economy. The Secretary will report to Congress on the program's outcomes, including recommendations for its continuation or expansion.
